extends java.lang.Object

    Salvatore Giampa'

      Constructor and Description
      ObjectPeer(java.net.Socket socket, ObjectRegistry registry)
      Constructs a new ObjectPeer over the connection specified by the given socket, with the specified ObjectRegistry.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectPeer

        public ObjectPeer(java.net.Socket socket,
                  ObjectRegistry registry)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new ObjectPeer over the connection specified by the given socket, with the specified ObjectRegistry.
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket over which the ObjectPeer will be created
        registry - the ObjectRegistry to use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        connect(String, int, ObjectRegistry), connect(String, int)

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static ObjectPeer connect(java.lang.String address,
                                 int port)
                          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Connects to the selected address and port and creates a new ObjectPeer over that connection, with a new empty ObjectRegistry
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the object server
        port - the port of the object server
        Returns:
        the ObjectPeer object representing the remote object server
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • connect

        public static ObjectPeer connect(java.lang.String address,
                                 int port,
                                 ObjectRegistry registry)
                          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Connects to the selected address and port and creates a new ObjectPeer over that connection, with the specified ObjectRegistry
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the object server
        port - the port of the object server
        registry - the registry that must be used by the ObjectPeer
        Returns:
        the ObjectPeer object representing the remote object server
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getStub

        public <T> T getStub(java.lang.String objectId,
                     java.lang.Class<T> stubInterface)
        Gets a stub for the specified object identifier respect to the specified interface, representing a remote object on the object server. This method performs no network operation, just creates the stub.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the stub interface type
        Parameters:
        objectId - the object identifier
        stubInterface - the interface whose methods must be stubbed, that is the interface used to access the remote object operations
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy object that represents the remote instance. It is an instance for the specified stub interface

      • getRegistry

        public ObjectRegistry getRegistry()
        Gets the registry used by this ObjectPeer
        Returns:
        the registry used by this peer

      • getInetSocketAddress

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getInetSocketAddress()
        Gets the remote connection details of this peer
        Returns:
        the InetSocketAddress containing remote host address and port

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Dispose this ObjectPeer and frees all the used resources and threads. After the call to this method, the call to the getStub(String, Class) method will result in an IllegalStateException and all the stubs generated by this ObjectPeer object will not function properly. A call to this method cause a callback on the failure observers attached to the registry sending them an instance of PeerDispositionException

      • getCreatedStubs

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> getCreatedStubs()
        Gets an unmodifiable collection containing all the stubs created by this ObjectPeer
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection containing stubs

      • isDisposed

        public boolean isDisposed()
        Gets the disposed status of this peer
        Returns:
        true if this peer has been disposed, false otherwise
